intro: Silene colorata var. parviflora, commonly known as the dwarf pink, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
